bbc.title: Thousands of Epstein documents taken down after victims identified
bbc.description: The US Department of Justice faces criticism from victims after names and unredacted images included in latest release.

bbc.title: US says it shot down Iranian drone flying towards aircraft carrier
bbc.description: A US military spokesman says the drone was shot down while approaching an American vessel in the Arabian Sea.

bbc.title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of ex-Libyan leader, reportedly shot dead
bbc.description: The 53-year-old, who was once widely seen as the second most powerful person in Libya, was killed on Tuesday according to Libyan media.

bbc.title: Trial of Norway crown princess's son hears tearful account in rape trial
bbc.description: The first alleged victim begins giving evidence in Marius Borg Høiby's trial for rape and more than 30 other alleged offences.

bbc.title: Watch: BBC joins Colombian commandos fighting 'never-ending battle' against drug gangs
bbc.description: As the US and Colombian presidents meet, Orla Guerin joins a police unit tasked with finding and destroying jungle cocaine labs.

bbc.title: Spain announces plans to ban social media for under-16s
bbc.description: Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez says the move will protect children from the "digital Wild West".

bbc.title: Fourteen migrants dead after collision with Greek coastguard boat
bbc.description: The coastguard said a pursuit was under way at the time of the collision, near the island of Chios.

bbc.title: Rights groups say China detained two journalists over corruption report
bbc.description: Liu Hu and Wu Yingjiao have been reportedly detained after exposing corruption by a senior official in Sichuan.

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Leading China Property Developer Reports Huge loss, in Sign of Widening Real-Estate Woes
wsj.description: Troubles at Vanke raise questions about the continued spread of the property crisis and whether the Chinese state will step in.

wsj.title: Freed Israeli Hostages Still Had Shrapnel in Their Bodies From Oct. 7 Attack
wsj.description: Some of the women were held alone for extended periods and spent eight months in tunnels, an Israeli medical official said.

wsj.title: Suspected Sabotage of Deep-Sea Cable Triggers First NATO-Led Response
wsj.description: The alliance mounted its first coordinated response to a suspected sabotage campaign against critical infrastructure after another cable was severed in the Baltic Sea.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Italy Supports Saudi Arabia Joining Fighter-Jet Program, PM Meloni Says
wsj.description: The U.K., Italy and Japan have already partnered on the Global Combat Air Programme, which aims to put a new stealth fighter with supersonic capability in the skies by 2035.

wsj.title: Shippers Wary of Red Sea Routes Despite Houthi Pledge to End Targeting
wsj.description: The world’s top three container operators said they fear instability in Gaza and broader regional tensions mean continued danger.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
wsj.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

wsj.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
wsj.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

wsj.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
wsj.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

wsj.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
wsj.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on Colombia.

wsj.title: Swiss franc, Japanese yen Rise as DeepSeek News Boosts Safe Havens
wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.

wsj.title: Natural Gas Falls on Shifting Weather Forecasts
wsj.description: U.S. natural gas futures fell after weekend updates took some of the chill out of early February weather forecasts.

wsj.title: Building-Products Distributor QXO Launches Hostile Bid for Beacon
wsj.description: QXO is taking its offer directly to shareholders after being rebuffed on several occasions.

bloomberg.title: Marcos Dodges Impeachment Risk as Corruption Complaints Junked

bloomberg.title: Chinese Solar Shares Rally on Report of Musk’s Team Visits
bloomberg.description: Chinese solar stocks rallied after local media reported that teams from SpaceX and Tesla Inc. had visited domestic companies, buoying sentiment.

bloomberg.title: Software Stocks Fall in Asia After US Tech Selloff: Markets Wrap
bloomberg.description: Software stocks slid from India to Japan, following declines in their US peers, on concern advances in artificial intelligence will undermine traditional business models.

bloomberg.title: Singapore’s GIC, Temasek Revamp Dealings With Hedge Funds
bloomberg.description: Singapore’s two largest state-owned investors are making major changes to the way they work with hedge funds, in moves that could affect billions of dollars in allocations.

bloomberg.title: Hedge Funds Revive Yen-Weakness Trades Ahead of Japan Vote
bloomberg.description: Hedge funds are reviving bets against the yen, positioning for renewed weakness as Japan heads into a pivotal election this weekend.

bloomberg.title: Abu Dhabi Oil Giant Plans Up to $2 Billion of Dim Sum Bonds
bloomberg.description: Abu Dhabi National Oil Co., the United Arab Emirates’ biggest oil producer, is planning to offer its first-ever yuan bond, the latest sign of deepening financial ties between China and the Gulf.

bloomberg.title: Oil Rises on Flare-Up in US-Iran Tensions and Inventory Decline
bloomberg.description: Oil rose for a second day as geopolitical tensions resurfaced following the US downing of an Iranian drone near an American aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea.

bloomberg.title: Son of Libyan Dictator Qaddafi Was Shot Dead, Prosecutor Says
bloomberg.description: Saif Al-Islam Qaddafi, the son and once heir-apparent of Libya’s deposed dictator Muammar Qaddafi, was confirmed killed in a shooting, the North African nation’s chief prosecutor said.

bloomberg.title: Steeper Discounts on Russian Oil Test India Response to US Deal
bloomberg.description: Discounts on Russian oil being offered to Indian refiners have widened over the past 10 days, raising the question of whether processors will be encouraged to snap up cargoes despite a trade agreement

bloomberg.title: South Korea’s Top Envoy Meets Rubio as Trump’s New Tariff Looms

bloomberg.title: Merz Seeks LNG Deals in Gulf Region to Hedge US Energy Exposure
bloomberg.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has set his sights on the Middle East to try and diversify energy supplies for Europe’s biggest economy and reduce dependency on LNG imports from the US.

bloomberg.title: Ukrainians Defy Russia's Attempts to Freeze Them Into Submission
bloomberg.description: With the temperature plunging and blackouts persisting, Europe worries how long Ukraine can hold out.

bloomberg.title: India Made Long Push With Trump Behind Scenes to Clinch US Deal
bloomberg.description: In early September, shortly after Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a chummy meeting with Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping in China, he dispatched his national security adviser to Washington to he

bloomberg.title: Indonesian Bond Demand Hits One-Year Low After MSCI Kerfuffle
bloomberg.description: Demand for Indonesian government bonds weakened to its lowest in about a year, after investability concerns raised by MSCI Inc. about the nation’s stocks spilled over into broader markets.

bloomberg.title: New York, New Jersey Sue Trump Administration Over Tunnel Funds
bloomberg.description: The Trump administration was sued again — this time by the states of New York and New Jersey — over its cutoff of financing for the $16 billion Gateway rail tunnel under the Hudson River.

aljazeera.title: LIVE: Israeli attacks kill 10 Palestinians; restrictions at Rafah crossing
